item.title: Report E-2025060296
item.description:
Report E-2025060296

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-13
  • City: MARIETTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 13, 2025, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN3264 was forked and released approximately twenty (20) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed granular absorbents and soda ash to the release and swept them in with hand tools. All poly aluminum hydroxychloride product was transferred from the damaged 330-gallon tote to a new 330-gallon tote and staged onsite. All spent absorbents were containerized in two 55-gallon drums, and crews cut down the damaged 330-gallon tote and placed that into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2025060267
item.description:
Report E-2025060267

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-11
  • City: MARIETTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 11, 2025, three (3) 1-gallon pails of paint were forked and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior, loading dock floor, and concrete beneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and the damaged pails were placed in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.description:
Report X-2025051435

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-17
  • City: CONLEY
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Kirk Smith, 086 Operations Supervisor, contacted Safety regarding a UN3378 spill on the dock floor. Kirk Smith advised a bag being ripped at the top of the pallet. Kirk Smith stated at this time it is unknown what caused the damage to the freight. Kirk Smith advised Safety he believes a worker was m oving freight when it rubbed against the damaged bag causing the rip. Kirk Smith stated he will request video footage. Reagan Cowdrey with CURA was contacted for remediation.

item.description:
Report E-2025050286

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-14
  • City: MARIETTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 14, 2025, one (1) 1-gallon pail of UN1789 in one (1) box was damaged by a forklift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized granular absorbents and hand tools to remediate the dock floor. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025060016
item.description:
Report E-2025060016

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-01
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 5:20 AM ET, BAT contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred inside of a trailer in Ellenwood, GA. The spill consists of approximately 1 quart of Duracoat PreCatalyzed, which released from (1) 1-gallon metal pail due to a loading error that caused the box containing the pail to be damaged, leaking onto the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, who stated they will clean the spill and placed the waste into a 10-gallon metal drum.
